sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>sun</radical> AND the <radical>moon</radical> are out? With both their light-powers combined, it's incredibly <kanji>bright</kanji> outside.
meaningInfo: Look up at both of them, hanging out in the sky together. Make them super bright, so bright you have to shield your eyes.
readingMnemonic: When do things start to get <kanji>bright</kanji> outside? I'd say when things start getting sunny, and that is the month of <reading>May</reading> (<ja>めい</ja>). If you live in the Southern Hemisphere, it's bright in May because of all the snow, or because that's when all the streetlights come on.
readingInfo: Depending on where you live, you might want to come up with a different reason for all that brightness in May. Perhaps it's because of Mother's Day, since we all know how brightly mothers shine. The important thing is to remember just how bright the month of May is, for whatever reason!
